subject: Ethics
title: CSR Origins and Evolution
description: A short lesson to help you apply CSR Origins and Evolution.

hook.text: In 1953, a book asked: what does business owe society? Corporate social responsibility was born.

buildup.text: Howard Bowen argued businessmen are stewards of public resources and must consider social consequences.

discovery.text: CSR evolved from charity in the 1960s to strategic sustainability programs worth billions today.

twist.text: Critics say CSR is just marketing. Companies donate millions publicly while lobbying against regulation privately.

climax.text: Modern CSR is a spectrumâ€”from genuine commitment to cynical window dressing. Telling them apart is the challenge.

punchline.text: Good deeds make great ads. Intent is harder to measure.

quiz.question: Who is considered the father of corporate social responsibility?
